meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your boy here, and I'm stoked to be diving into Men of War II, a WWII real-time strategy game that's got the critics in a tizzy. Before we get started, let me just say that I'm not exactly thrilled about writing this review. You see, I'm still reeling from the trauma of playing through my first few hours with this game. But hey, someone's gotta do it, right?

So, what's the deal with Men of War II? Well, according to some folks, like SpazioGames, it's a deep RTS game that's got a lot of complexity and depth, but might be a bit overwhelming for casual players. COGconnected thinks it's approachable, but only if you're willing to put in the time and effort. And PC Gamer? They call it "flawed but rewarding" for masochistic RTS fans (um, hi, that's me!).

Now, I know what you're thinking: what about the always-online requirement? Yeah, Cubed3 wasn't a fan of that either, saying it's a major turn-off. But hey, at least GameSpew thinks the game makes up for it with its realism, depth, and freedom to explore your own strategies.

So, what did I think? Well, let's just say I'm still trying to get my bearings after playing through those first few hours. The UI is clunky, the gameplay is complex, and don't even get me started on the always-online thing (I mean, come on, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned internet outage in the middle of a critical mission?).

But hey, despite all that, I have to admit that Men of War II has got some serious potential. The graphics are solid, the sound design is top-notch, and when things click (literally and figuratively), it can be pretty darn satisfying.

All in all, Men of War II is a tough nut to crack, but if you're up for the challenge, it might just be worth your while. Just don't say I didn't warn you about those controls... or that always-online thing...
